issues.description: The UML in the problem statement declares getNumberOfStudentsPerTutor() with return type int, while the template's TODO comment and the provided solution implement/expect a double return type. This inconsistency can confuse students about which return type to implement and may cause compilation/test failures if they follow the UML (int) instead of the template hint/solution (double).
issues.suggested_fix: Make the return type consistent across all artifacts. Recommended: update the UML in the problem statement to show getNumberOfStudentsPerTutor(): double (and mention the double return type in the textual task description), since the template hints at double and the solution implements double. Alternatively, change the template hint and solution to use int if an integer result is intended, but ensure all three artifacts match.
